medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset right upper quadrant abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced acute onset of right upper quadrant abdominal pain 1 day prior to presentation. She had a history of nausea following fatty meals for the past few years. After a pain-free period of avoiding fatty meals, the patient experienced acute abdominal pain and nausea after dinner the previous night. The pain progressed overnight, leading to multiple bouts of non-bloody, non-bilious emesis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, osteoarthritis, history of epigastric hernia, unknown cyst removal, and cesarean section.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of colon cancer in mother; no gallbladder disorders.
